flow.descriptionCdata:
78302fd3-8d27-44ae-92c3-95646fc06863.058820ad-684b-41fb-8804-1bd502e0ab81.prompt=Send email\: 78302fd3-8d27-44ae-92c3-95646fc06863.05f383ce-60d8-4513-91e5-1f043347fcfa.prompt=Email port\: 78302fd3-8d27-44ae-92c3-95646fc06863.077268ff-0287-4aee-a1a1-75faed04b6ac.transition.description=No email is being sent ${subject} ${body} 78302fd3-8d27-44ae-92c3-95646fc06863.0dbf0396-695e-4c5c-b120-29bdcaa06e31.description=
This operation is used to send a smtp email.
 
Inputs\:
    hostname - The hostname or ip address of the smtp server.
    port - The port smtp service is listening.
    from - From email address.
    to - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients.
    cc - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients, to be placed in the CC.
    bcc - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients, to be placed in the BCC.
    subject - The email subject. If a subject spans on multiple lines, it is formatted to a single one.
    body - The body of the email.
    htmlEmail - The value should be true if the email is in rich text/html format. The value should be false if the email is in plain text format.
Valid values\: true, false. 
Default value\: true. 
    readReceipt - The value should be true if read receipt is required, else false. 
Valid values\: true, false. 
Default value\: false. 
    attachments - A delimiter separated list of files to attach (must be full path).
    headers - This input contains extra headers you want to be added in the mail. The input has a 'Map' format. Header names are separated from header values through a column delimiter and headers will be separated between them by a row delimiter.
Example\:
    Sensitivity\:Company-Confidential
    message-type\:Multiple Part
    Sensitivity\:Personal
In the above example, the columnDelimiter is "\:" and the rowDelimiter is the new line. You can define multiple values for the same header like in the example above. The delimiters can have multiple characters, but be careful that the rowDelimiter is not a substring of the columnDelimiter.
    rowDelimiter - The delimiter that separates headers in the 'headers' input.
Default value\: "\:"
Examples\: '|', '\='
    columnDelimiter - The delimiter that separates the header name from header value on the same row.
Default value\: "\n"	
Examples\: ';', '\#'
    username - If SMTP authentication is needed, the username to send.
    password - If SMTP authentication is needed, the password to use.
    characterSet - The character set encoding for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. 
Valid values\: UTF-8, UTF-16, UTF-32, EUC-JP, ISO-2022-JP, Shift_JIS, Windows-31J.
Default value\: UTF-8.
    contentTransferEncoding - The content transfer encoding scheme (such as 7bit, 8bit, base64, quoted-printable etc) for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. 
Valid values\: quoted-printable, base64, 7bit, 8bit, binary, x-token.
Default value\: quoted-printable (or Q Encoding).
    delimiter - A delimiter to separate the email recipients and the attachments.
Default value\: ','
    proxyHost - The proxy server used to access the web site.
    proxyPort - The proxy server port.
Default value\: 8080
    proxyUsername - The user name used when connecting to the proxy.
    proxyPassword - The proxy server password associated with the "proxyUsername" input value.
    enableTLS - Enables starttls. If the server supports TLS or SSL, the communications will be secured by TLS or SSL. If it doesn't support TLS or SSL the communication will be unsecure.
Valid values\: true, false. 
Default value\: false.
    tlsVersion - The version of TLS to use. The value of this input will be ignored if "'enableTLS"/"enableSSL" is set to "false". When the STARTTLS value is given to the tlsVersion input, the most secure SSL/TLS version supported by the target server will be used to create the connection. If the target server does not support STARTTLS the connection will fail.
Valid values\: STARTTLS, SSLv3, TLSv1, TLSv1.1, TLSv1.2.
Default value\: TLSv1.2.
    encryptionAlgorithm - A comma delimited list of cyphers to use. The value of this input will be ignored if "tlsVersion" does not contain "TLSv1.2". This capability is provided “as is”, please see product documentation for further security considerations. In order to connect successfully to the target host, it should accept at least one of the following cyphers. If this is not the case, it is the user's responsibility to configure the host accordingly or to update the list of allowed cyphers.
Default value\: TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256,TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256, TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256, TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256, TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256, TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384, TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256, TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256.
    encryptionKeystore - The path to the pks12 formatted keystore used to encrypt the mail.
    encryptionKeyAlias - The alias of a RSA key pair from the encryptionKeystore. The public key from the pair will be used to encrypt the mail. The key pair must not have password. The recommended key size is 2048 bit or higher.
    encryptionKeystorePassword - The password for the encryptionKeystore.
    timeout - The timeout in seconds for sending the mail message.

Responses\:
    success - Successfully sent the email.
    failure - Failed to send the email.

Note\:
1. For special characters (East Asian, right-to-left languages, etc.) you must install the support files on your local machine.
2. For doing this on Windows go to Control Panel -> Regional and Language Options -> Language and check the options at Supplemental language support.
3. You can use KeyStore Explorer to obtain RSA Keystore with keyPairs for encryption/decryption.
    3.1 If you get "llegal key size exception" you don't have JCE Unlimited Strength installed.
78302fd3-8d27-44ae-92c3-95646fc06863.0f3c5687-a901-4fe3-b574-82a986b288d6.prompt=Attachments\: 78302fd3-8d27-44ae-92c3-95646fc06863.1a569444-2938-49c0-8974-e4c2cb23bd9a.prompt=Password\: 78302fd3-8d27-44ae-92c3-95646fc06863.1ad51048-61d4-4ae2-82fa-3e50971e32d3.prompt=Character set\: 78302fd3-8d27-44ae-92c3-95646fc06863.3410805e-3612-429f-af02-70489e2a6b65.prompt=Read receipt\: 78302fd3-8d27-44ae-92c3-95646fc06863.4a00fe12-7d12-4d96-b264-661667c53923.prompt=Email from\: 78302fd3-8d27-44ae-92c3-95646fc06863.5d5c496c-9fad-4856-a2b6-b52e4267d19f.prompt=Subject\: 78302fd3-8d27-44ae-92c3-95646fc06863.609e406c-2ca6-403a-8414-c71d9fe35d74.prompt=Email host\: 78302fd3-8d27-44ae-92c3-95646fc06863.84e7efe1-46f0-4dce-9549-890f86782aa6.prompt=Subject\: 78302fd3-8d27-44ae-92c3-95646fc06863.91089d23-e23c-4787-83fe-46fa161e7e1c.prompt=Html email\: 78302fd3-8d27-44ae-92c3-95646fc06863.9407a080-4587-412d-a46b-14b7d4eaf34b.prompt=Email to\: 78302fd3-8d27-44ae-92c3-95646fc06863.99b75606-4fae-445f-83df-65d46915556c.description=Compares two strings lexigraphically. Inputs\: String1 - the first string. String2 - The string to compare string 1 to. ignoreCase - if set to 'true' then the compare is not case sensitive. responses\: before - if string 1 is alphabetically before string 2. after - if string 1 is alphabetically after string 2. equal - if string 1 is alphabetically equal to string 2. failure - if Somethign goes wrong. 78302fd3-8d27-44ae-92c3-95646fc06863.b4d91409-62b3-4d74-b89f-73e7acaae15c.prompt=Username\: 78302fd3-8d27-44ae-92c3-95646fc06863.d1b12fd0-e45c-4f61-becf-87185fd158d2.prompt=Host name\: 78302fd3-8d27-44ae-92c3-95646fc06863.dac7cbac-265d-4e2d-a1c0-ccd274abc0bb.prompt=From\: 78302fd3-8d27-44ae-92c3-95646fc06863.dbc44f13-91ea-4e43-98d2-b0afa5410b26.prompt=enable TLS\: 78302fd3-8d27-44ae-92c3-95646fc06863.description=
Does a string compare to see if it should send an email. Send an email unless the value it checks is 'false.'

Inputs\:
    emailHost - The SMTP host to use when sending email.
    emailPort - The SMTP port to use when sending email.
    emailFrom - The email address the message will come from.
    emailTo - The email address the message will go to.
    subject - The subject of the email.
    body - The  body of the email message.
    sendEmail - If set to false emails will not be sent, otherwise they will be.
    htmlEmail - The value should be true if the email is in rich text/html format. The value should be false if the email is in plain text format.
Valid values\: true, false. 
Default value\: true.
    readReceipt - The value should be true if read receipt is required, else false. 
Valid values\: true, false. 
Default value\: false. 
    attachments - A comma separated list of files to attach (must be full path).
    username - If SMTP authentication is needed, the username to send.
    password - The password to use.
    characterSet - The character set encoding for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is UTF-8.
    contentTransferEncoding - The content transfer encoding scheme (such as 7bit, 8bit, base64, quoted-printable etc) for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is - quoted-printable or Q Encoding.
    delimiter - A delimiter to separate the email recipients and the attachments.
    headers - This input contains extra headers you want to be added in the mail. The input has a 'Map' format. Header names are separated from header values through a column delimiter and headers will be separated between them by a row delimiter.
Example\:
    Sensitivity\:Company-Confidential
    message-type\:Multiple Part
    Sensitivity\:Personal
In the above example, the columnDelimiter is "\:" and the rowDelimiter is the new line. You can define multiple values for the same header like in the example above. The delimiters can have multiple characters, but be careful that the rowDelimiter is not a substring of the columnDelimiter.
    rowDelimiter - The delimiter that separates headers in the 'headers' input.
Default value\: "\:"
Examples\: '|', '\='
    columnDelimiter - The delimiter that separates the header name from header value on the same row.
Default value\: "\n"	
Examples\: ';', '\#'
    proxyHost - The proxy server used to access the web site.
    proxyPort - The proxy server port.
Default value\: 8080
    proxyUsername - The user name used when connecting to the proxy.
    proxyPassword - The proxy server password associated with the "proxyUsername" input value.
    enableTLS - Enables starttls. If the server supports TLS or SSL, the communications will be secured by TLS or SSL. If it doesn't support TLS or SSL the communication will be unsecure.
Valid values\: true, false. 
Default value\: false.
    tlsVersion - The version of TLS to use. The value of this input will be ignored if "'enableTLS"/"enableSSL" is set to "false". When the STARTTLS value is given to the tlsVersion input, the most secure SSL/TLS version supported by the target server will be used to create the connection. If the target server does not support STARTTLS the connection will fail.
Valid values\: STARTTLS, SSLv3, TLSv1, TLSv1.1, TLSv1.2.
Default value\: TLSv1.2.
    encryptionAlgorithm - A comma delimited list of cyphers to use. The value of this input will be ignored if "tlsVersion" does not contain "TLSv1.2". This capability is provided “as is”, please see product documentation for further security considerations. In order to connect successfully to the target host, it should accept at least one of the following cyphers. If this is not the case, it is the user's responsibility to configure the host accordingly or to update the list of allowed cyphers.
Default value\: TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256,TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256, TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256, TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256, TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256, TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384, TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256, TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256.
    encryptionKeystore - The path to the pks12 formatted keystore used to encrypt the mail.
    encryptionKeyAlias - The alias of a RSA key pair from the encryptionKeystore. The public key from the pair will be used to encrypt the mail. The key pair must not have password. The recommended key size is 2048 bit or higher.
    encryptionKeystorePassword - The password for the encryptionKeystore.
    timeout - The timeout in seconds for sending the mail message.

Responses\:
success - The operation was able to sent an email, unless it shouldn't have.
failure - The operation failed to send an email, but tried to.
78302fd3-8d27-44ae-92c3-95646fc06863.e8783844-87f4-401d-8dce-f1a95fd51b73.prompt=To\: 78302fd3-8d27-44ae-92c3-95646fc06863.ea2f8a76-5025-41b9-bcfd-03a0ad19395b.prompt=Body\: 78302fd3-8d27-44ae-92c3-95646fc06863.ef157b76-0ebe-48ae-8702-00c99e71f5a0.prompt=Body\: 78302fd3-8d27-44ae-92c3-95646fc06863.f6dc0b69-bfab-4d7c-b17d-39960bf79ee3.prompt=Content transfer encoding\:
flow.name: Test and Send Email

staticBinding.value: TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256,TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256, TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256, TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256, TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256, TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384, TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256, TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256

TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256,TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256, TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256, TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256, TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256, TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384, TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256, TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
